result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Ledesma informs the court an offer has been made and moves to continue for resolution.

09:14 AM
  Fred Svensson Interpreter appears. Defendant Erick Yony Salgado-Martinez in court with attorney Roberto R Ledesma. Prosecuting Atty Corinne L Frutiger appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Defendant Erick Yony Salgado-Martinez in court with attorney Roberto R Ledesma. Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Ledesma informs the court his client wishes to waive his right to preliminary hearing.
Court informs the defendant of his right to preliminary hearing and purpose of said hearing.
Court questions defendant re: his right to preliminary hearing.
Parties stipulate to a factual basis.
Court questions counsel re: his clients waiver of preliminary hearing.
Court finds waiver of preliminary is made freely, knowingly & voluntarily.
Court accepts waiver and orders bind over.

Information filed and formal reading waived.

"NOT GUILTY" entered.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
